fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to approve an issue from JIRA Software board in Sprint View.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have a workflow and add approval between 2 statuses (i.e In Progress -> Checking)
# Create an issue and transition it to _In Progress_
# Create a board and make sure to include the above issue.
# Create a Sprint, assign the above issue and start a Sprint.
# Click on the above issue so that it opens Issue Details View
# Attempt to approve it

h3. Actual Result

The board loaded and nothing happens.

h3. Expected Result

The issue gets approved and transition to the next status.

h3. Workaround 

Open the issue in _View Issue Screen_ and approve it there.
fields.summary: Unable to approve an issue from JIRA Software board

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-5025].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When moving an issue between Service Desk Projects, if the root Customer Request Type of the issue doesn't exist in the target project, the Customer Request Type will be set to "No Match" which will cause the issue to become invisible in the Customer Portal.
 Also, when searching for issues through JQL:
{code:java}
Customer Request Type is EMPTY{code}
The query will not result in issues that have been moved as they will issue still have the reference from the old request type in the database.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two Service Desk projects
 # Set two different Request Types between the projects
 # In the Customer Portal, create an issue in the project A using a request type that doesn't exist in project B
 # Move the issue to the Project B.
 # The Customer Request Type of the issue will be set to "No Match" and the issue will no longer be visible through the Customer Portal

h3. !Screen Shot 2017-03-24 at 4.44.26 PM (1).png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

When moving an issue to the other project, it should have an option to select the new Customer Request Type which you want to set your issue, if the target project doesn't have a Request Type with the same name of the root project.
h3. Actual Results

The issue is moved without the Customer Request Type and with a reference from the old Customer Request Type from the root project in the database.
fields.summary: Request Type is set to "No Match" when moving issues between Service Desk Projects

  {panel}

Would be nice if we could spawn child calls based off automation/workflows. 

 

*Use-Cases:*  

1) A secretary submits a "New Employee" request in the portal.  A parent "New Employee" ticket is created which also automatically spawns a child ticket to M&O to set up an office, to Tech Support to set up the computer/phone, and to Operations to create the user accounts.

2) A user requests a piece of software purchased and installed.  The initial request goes to the purchasing agent who confirms the request and purchases the software.  Once the purchaser closes the ticket it spawns a secondary ticket for Tech Support to install the software.
fields.summary: Automation can create child calls

Hello,

 

I am contacting you because I have some questions about Insight and insight discovery.

I have Jira server installed and I would like to know how the integration with Insight is.  

 

In our company, we are approximately 4.000 users divided in 12 domains (different sub-networks), each one with its own AD.

The users have Windows PC, mobile devices like iPhone, iPad, Android, etc.

Thank you very much for you time.

 

Regards

  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary

When an Admin schedules a maintenance window for the JIRA instance, there is no way they can announce this to all Service Desk customers or even have the announcement shown on the customer portal automatically for all projects.

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to Announcement Banner page.
# Add a message to the announcement banner.
# Go to the customer portal

Similarly, adding an announcement to the Help Desk does not carry over to All projects.

h5. Expected Result

JIRA Service Desk would show a similar Announcement in each customer portal to match what is seen in JIRA.

h5. Actual Result

Nothing would be shown in the JIRA Service Desk, hence users would not know that the instance is down for maintenance or even be alert before the maintenance day comes.

h5. Feature Request

Either have the Announcement Banner map to all Customer portals or have announcements added to the Help Desk page mapped to all customer portals.

h5. Workaround

{panel:title=Option 1}
# Go to the Customer portal for each project.
# Add an Announcement to each letting the user know that there is a scheduled downtime.
{panel}

{panel:title=Option 2}
# Setup a URL redirect to listen for users attempting to access either JIRA or JIRA service desk customer portals, redirecting them to a page that contains a message that the site is down for maintenance.
{panel}
fields.summary: System Wide Announcement For Maintenance

If an agent adds a customer directly to an Organization instead of adding them first as a Customer to the Project without them being part of an organization, they will be granted access to the Portal however they will not be listed in the Service Desk Customers project role.

h5. Issue Summary

When a user configures their Service Desk create request to contain a field help, the content of the help section will always appear on a single line failing to follow even HTML descriptions like the description section of fields found in JIRA.

h5. Usage Scenario

If a user want to let customer know what each option represents in an orderly manner, the ability to have each entry on a separate line would be great similar to the below:
{code}
Level 1 - For JIRA Outages, Critical Functions Broken.
Level 2 - For Major functions breaking or impacts a large number of people
Level 3 - Non-major functions breaking or impacts a small number of users
Level 4 - For learning about specific functions.
{code}

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to {{Your Project > Project Settings > Request Type}} page.
# Select the Edit field link.
# In the page that comes up, add the field *Priority*.
# In the field help section, attempt to add a description with multiple lines.
#- On pressing {{Shift+enter}}, instead of creating a new line the parameter is saved.
# If you instead add an HTML script such as the below, it would still appear as a single line:
{code}
Level 1 - This is a Level 1 </br>
Level 2 - This is a Level 2 </br>
Level 3 - This is a Level 3 </br>
Level 4 - This is a Level 4 </br>
{code}

h5. Expected Result

Service Desk would obey the above and show the entries on multiple lines.

h5. Actual Result

JIRA Service Desk would show all entries on a single line as seen below(server result vs Service Desk result)

 !image-2017-03-20-17-49-10-891.png|thumbnail!  vs  !image-2017-03-20-17-49-50-533.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4954].
{panel}
{panel}
*UPDATE: 8th June 2021*

Hi everyone, good news - this has been implemented as part of a related improvement to CSAT for team-managed projects (this change applies to both team-managed and company-managed projects). The CSAT email is now sent out when either:
 * The resolution field is set to some value (from empty) OR
 * The status category of the issue's status is changed to 'Done'

Cheers,

Oliver Wessels and the Jira Service Management team.
{panel}
h5. Issue Summary

When a service desk agent closes an issue, if they are using a customized workflow or field configuration that does not make the resolution field compulsory, when the issue is closed, not customer satisfaction survey is sent as JIRA still considers the issue as being unresolved which is the condition required to be met for surveys as stated [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER033/Collecting+customer+satisfaction+%28CSAT%29+feedback].
h5. Usage Scenario

In a company that does not mark issues based on resolution and only worry about transitioning the ticket to the closed status, there is no way for them to send out a custom survey for the customer to fill since JIRA would in all scenarios consider the issue as resolved.
h5. Feature Request

Allow JIRA Service Desk to recognize the *closed* state as a point to trigger the CSAT survey rather than just the Resolve issue.

This would help ensure that teams can have notifications sent to their customers once the the issue issue is closed.
h5. Existing

JIRA checks if the resolution field is field when the issue is closed and then triggers the notification.
h5. Workaround

Users can setup a generic resolution for their team when an issue has been resolved so that their issues would always be resolved to this generic resolution instead of having the field blank.
fields.summary: Allow CSAT to be Sent without Resolution
Supported browsers to use JIRa Service Desk cannot be always the latest versions

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the previously corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4952].

h3. Summary

In Cloud, it's possible to retrieve attachments for a request via REST API albeit being experimental (requires HTTP header "X-ExperimentalApi":"opt-in"). Example:
 * GET /rest/servicedeskapi/request/\{issueIdOrKey}/attachment
 * GET /rest/servicedeskapi/request/\{issueIdOrKey}/comment/\{commentId}/attachment

(i) Reference: https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/cloud/#servicedeskapi/request/ \{issueIdOrKey}/attachment

However, the underlying redirection in comments to /secure/{"thumbnail" or "attachment"}/{commentId}/myimage.png?fromIssue={issueId} creates a problem for Connect Apps because Safari blocks cross-site cookies. This forces Apps to awkward and potentially unsafe proxies of the attachments.

h3. Suggestion

Allow Jira to process attachment calls from API clients using the `ACT_AS_USER` mechanism to respect both user permissions and browser policies. And stabilize the APIs so the experimental header and label can be removed.
fields.summary: REST API to retrieve attachments from requests

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4951].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Current SLA sorting for Ongoing issues are listed first with the shortest time remaining at the beginning of the list.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow SLA to be sorted by remaining time as well as consumed time

h3. Why this is important
Quick Response & Resolution time for Issue, highlighted to Customer as well as easy to identify the delay response
fields.summary: Sort SLA by time remaining as well as consumed time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4950].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, if a Service Desk Agent wants to raise a Service Desk request for the Service Desk customer, the user will need to use *Raise a request* functionality so that all the Service Desk features for the request will work as expected. But this will add another step for the Agent to fill in all the Agent related information after raising the request. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Instead of using the fields that are configured for the Request Type in the Customer Portal view for the Customer, it would be good if the *Raise a request* feature actually picks up fields from the Create issue screen of the project. This also will avoid Service Desk Agent not to misuse JIRA Service Desk by creating Service Desk request via the normal Create button on the menu bar - which will end up breaking the Service Desk features for all the request.
fields.summary: Raise a request feature should include fields from the Create issue screen rather than the fields in the Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4949].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
I would like to be able to create and customize different login pages for the different Service Desks in my JIRA Help Center. 

Branding and suggestion text may differ between Service Desks, but this level of granularity in customization is not available.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow for the creation of separate login pages per Service Desk, and make them individually customizable. 

h5. Note
There is a separate request for being able to Customize the text on the login page for the Customer Portal in general in [JSD-330|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-330]
fields.summary: As a Service Desk Administrator I would like to be able to have a custom login page to the Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4947].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*

User A1 and A2 belong to company A and are emailing user B1 from company B, with the JSD enable mailbox in Cc. If user A2 replies on the same email thread and removes B1 from his reply (i.e. just having a private company talk), the JSD email parser does not recognize this act and the message is still visible to B1. In other words, user B1 keeps being a participant of the issue even though we remove B1 from Cc field.

*Suggested Solution*

Make it possible for JSD to recognize when an email address is removed from an email thread and automatically remove the user from the issue.

*Why this is important*

Business users generally don't know the intricacies of a JSD enabled mailbox. They don't understand that email replies with the same subject get tagged together into the ticket.

It is normal business practice (at all companies) to split off an email discussion to an internal group and exclude the external customer from private info.
fields.summary: Email parsing when users have private conversations
Add "Turn off notifications" link to email templates

h3. Problem Definition
If the project's email channel is not enabled, the Preview (HTML & CSS) of the customer notifications template will not show a line and the sentence "Reply above this line" below the line in the template. 

h3. Suggested Solution
* Mention this behavior in the documentation
* Make the behavior consistent regardless of the condition of the email channel
fields.summary: The behavior of the reply line in the Customer notifications templates preview
enlarge the window with suggestions from Confluence KB in JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4943].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The default permission scheme created for Service Desk projects have a couple of permissions granted to Customer users for actions that they are unable to perform, such as deleting issues, assign issues and modify the reporter.

h3. Suggested Solution
Adjust the default permissions so they reflect the actual permissions for customer users.

h3. Why this is important
This will avoid confusion when setting up permissions for projects.
fields.summary: Default service desk permissions should reflect actual customer permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4942].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

After Service Desk 3.1 where there is no need for users to have a license in Confluence to be able to access the Confluence Knowledge Base through Service Desk, there's a few restrictions to accomplish that:
 # Have the same user base in both JSD & Confluence. You can accomplish this by using JIRA as a user directory for Confluence or by having JIRA Service Desk and Confluence use Crowd to share a user base.
 # Manually create a user in Confluence for every customer in JSD that will need access to the Knowledge Base. You can create a "customer" account in Confluence by not assigning it to a group. This will not count against your Confluence license.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a specific permission on Confluence to allow Service Desk customers to search KB articles without a Confluence license.
h3. Why this is important

Since SDS can be fulfilled with new customers frequently, it can be a massive task to create customers account on the Confluence side just to provide them the ability to access KB articles through Service Desk
fields.summary: Allow SDS customers to search for Confluence's KB articles without the same user base

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4941].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At this time, when customising the subject line of a notification template it is only possible to add the Portal name, issue's subject and key as a variable.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add more fields as accepted variables to the subject line, such as status and priority.

h3. Why this is important
This allow users to evaluate notifications with a glance on the mailbox without the need of opening the message.
fields.summary: Allow more fields to populate customised subjects on notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4940].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Notification to Hipchat is not working if the filter contains AND parameter. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect JIRA to Hipchat 
# Use the following filter with the AND parameter :
{code:borderStyle=solid}
issuetype in ("Service Request") AND "Customer Request Type" in ("Service Onboarding")  
{code}
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Notification to HipChat chatroom should be pushed.

h3. Actual Results
No notification to HipChat chatroom is pushed. 

h3. Notes
Bug does not occur on JIRA 7.3.1 with ServiceDesk 3.3.1
fields.summary: HipChat notification not sent when using AND parameter for FILTER
Customer permissions instead of Request Security

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4937].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The default customer permission/request security settings (name changed in 3.3) is too permissive or some administrators as it allows users to see the portal when you click *Browse All* in the *Help Center* 
h3. Suggested Solution

Add a scheme, template, or allow global configuration of the default values so that new projects can be automatically hidden if desired by the administrator.
h3. Workaround

Edit the customer permission/request security settings immediately after creating the JIRA Service Desk project.
fields.summary: Customer permissions/Request security should be configurable via a template or scheme

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4935].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when creating customer , it is a must to provide email information. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow to create customer using username without email.
h3. Why this is important

In some cases, customers may integrate JIRA Service Desk with their own tool which identify via a device ID or user ID and not email is required. Having one email address per user would not be a scalable solution.
fields.summary: Allow create customer without email

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Since 3.3.0, we can now style notifications with HTML, CSS, and plain text templates. 

h3. Suggested Solution
A template with the previous design so that we can apply the template and modify the default template, just like the Microsoft Office templates for Excel, Word and etc.

h3. Why this is important
We can keep using the previous design without too many changes
fields.summary: Sample HTML or CSS templates for customer notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4931].
  {panel}

Recently, i've had a scenario where i have a group of users that want to be able to view any ticket creation they wish but to only receive notifications for business critical (severity 1) incidents raised

Our users currently receive 'all notifications' when an issue is created. I've had to set this in place as i have no other way to be able to filter out with a rule to select specific users to only receive a particular scenario of incident created

It work work for my situation if we could set up users to be in the same group as all users but to be able to set up an exclusion rule so they do not receive all notifications for issues created or updated

The reason for this request is because the users are part of a senior executive leadership team and whilst they want to be able to view a ticket as they see fit...they only want to be contacted via email notification when the problem is critical
fields.summary: User notification rules

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4929].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
Our workflow has many statuses that we display to the customer. Some are specific in that the ticket is waiting for the customer's response and our customers are currently having the most trouble location those tickets so being able to pull the tickets up by status would be helpful to us.

h3. Suggestion
Let customers be able to sort based on the status of the ticket on Customer Portal

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Let customers be able to sort based on the status of the ticket on Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4926].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, it is not possible to distinguish between internal or customer facing comment notifications.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add a label to the notification to allow the notification receiver to distinguish internal comments from public comments
h3. Why this is important
For an organization which receives a large number of requests and would like to have a way to distinguish between internal and public comments in order to better triage the notifications, they receive from the Jira Service Desk.
fields.summary: Add Internal comment labels for internal comment notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4925].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Microsoft Outlook 2007/2010 unable to process URLs longer than 1033 characters. Password reset emails can exceed this character limit making the password reset link unusable.

Microsoft TechNet Thread: [Outlook 2010 URL Character Limit|https://social.technet.microsoft.com/Forums/office/en-US/bfbaf146-5f48-42cc-8172-41eb7be2e595/outlook-2010-what-is-the-character-limit-for-a-link-to-open?forum=outlook].
h3. Suggested Solution

Find ways to shorten the URL so that Outlook 2007/2010 can handle them.
h3. Why this is important

Many customers are using Outlook 2007/2010 as their default mail client.
h3. Workaround

Use a web browser or another email client.
fields.summary: Long links/URLs don't work in Outlook 2007/2010
Improve documentation on Serving customers with a knowledge base

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4923].
  {panel}

We purchased JIRA Service Desk for our customers to be able to do self service by searching our Confluence Knowledge Base. The problem is the Customer Portal display window to see the Knowledge Base articles is tiny and the screen shows vertical and horizontal scroll bars.

 

This is a terrible user experience and quite frankly renders the use of both Confluence and JIRA Service for Customer self service useless.

 

We are considering alternative solutions to solve this basic problem that we consider a major product limitation.

 

Please advise if we can increase the size of the window that displays the knowledge article to customers and it would also be beneficial to allow users to click on an image and have it open up in full view just like Confluence does - not sure why you have these important features for employee facing users of Confluence and remove them for self service Customers in JIRA Service Desk.
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk Customer Portal is too small to view Knowledge-base articles

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4922].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in JSD, if a workflow transition can be triggered on Customer Portal, a popup asking for an optional comment is displayed when customer triggers that transition.
However there is no option in JSD/Workflow settings that can make this comment field mandatory.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option in JSD or Workflow settings that allows administrator to make this comment field mandatory.
fields.summary: Allow JSD to make comment required on transition in Customer Portal
"pendingBy" JQL Function Example is Incorrect
Allow use of "Reply-To" for the Reporter Field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4919].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access any SDS project
# Navigate through the SDS queue
# Edit one of the queues and try to rename to an already existing one
# No message will be displayed and it would like the application isn't processing the request

h3. Expected Results
As you're tying to rename a specific queue to an existing one, a message should be displayed as "A queue with that name already exists." 

h3. Actual Results
No message is displayed in the UI, however and if you open the developer tools within the web browser, JIRA will return the status code  400 with the response below (Only visible in the developer tools):
- {noformat}{"errors":[{"errorMessage":"A queue with that name already exists."}],"reasonKey":"sd.admin.queue.create.error.duplicate","reasonCode":"400"}{noformat}
 
h3. Notes 
When you try to create a new queue (instead of editing an existing one) and add a name that already exists, the application will return the following in the UI:
* A queue with that name already exists
fields.summary: Rename a queue to a queue that already exists does not trigger any message

Monitor # Then, do the same but using the available Public Experimental REST API #- [JIRA Service Desk Public API|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/server/#servicedeskapi/servicedesk/] {code}POST /rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/{serviceDeskId}/requesttype{code} h3. fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4911].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Starting with Service Desk 3.3.0 the *Subject* of Service Desk notifications no longer appears to automatically vary with the action being notified about.

For example, in JSD 3.1.x, if an Agent resolved a ticket, the Customer would receive a notification with a Subject like this: {quote}[Prefix] Request resolved as "Done" #EXAMPLE-3: test request{quote}

However in JSD 3.3.0 this behavior changed and the equivalent action results in a notification with a subject as follows, using the default template: {quote}EXAMPLE-3 test request{quote}

For reference the default template is: {code:borderStyle=solid}${issue.key} ${issue.summary}{code} 

The only variables available for the *Subject* are: 
* Issue key
* Issue summary
* Portal name

h3. Suggested Solution
Make additional variables available to refer to the action being performed.

This may not be sufficient, however, as there are cases where multiple actions are placed into a single notification, in which case I'm not sure how that would work. 

h3. Why this is important
Filtering notifications is much easier when notifications for different events carry different subjects.
fields.summary: Allow additional customization of customer notification email's subject line

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, SD customers only have the ability to search for articles from the customer portal. The returned result will be based on the searched keywords.

h3. Suggested Solution
# Create an option of displaying a dashboard where the user can browse KB documents according to labels or according to an index with a dynamic filter search bar on top. It would be great as well if the number of returned results is at least 10.
# Create a macro template in Confuence that can be added to a document which is then used as an index to enable the user to browse KB files.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to browse Confluence Knowledge Base articles based on category
Can be closed: Ability to do bulk edit of Customer Request Type.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4904].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When there's too many projects within your instance (~2000) and you access the *ViewProjects.jspa* (JIRA Administration > Projects) with the administrator account, the page takes many minutes to load and there's a high consume of RAM to render the page.

However, this is not caused when accessing *BrowseProjects.jspa* (Projects > View All Projects) as it contains pagination and also a filter between the project types.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add pagination or a specific filter on *ViewProjects.jspa* such as *BrowseProjects.jspa*

h3. Why this is important
 
Avoid performance issues.
fields.summary: Improve the performance of ViewProjects.jspa

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition
As an agent, I would like to find out which organizations a customer belongs to even if they have chosen not to share the issue.  This would allow me to run reports on organizations impacted by a particular issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
I would like to be able to view an organization field which shows this information, or use automation to populate other fields based on this.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4901].
  {panel}

+underlined text+{panel:title=Response 15 March 2017}
Hi all,

Thanks for your responses.

We understand that this is a significant change for some of you. As part of making authentication and single sign-on easier across Atlassian products we have consolidated product access through Atlassian account ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-account-for-users-873871199.html]). This means that access to our products outside the customer portal requires an Atlassian account.

Customers can still search for KB articles, view articles, bookmark articles and so on using the customer portal. This does not require an Atlassian account as it's done through the customer portal.

If you need your customers to *directly* access Confluence to browse through KB articles, you can either:
 # Make your space anonymous-accessible. This will mean that anyone will be able to browse your KB articles without needing to log in. If you are experiencing issues as described in CONF-30161 then please make sure you have linked your space to a JIRA Service Desk project via Project Settings → Knowledge Base as this fixes the problem.
 # If you do not want to make your space anonymous accessible, ie. you want customers to explicitly log in before they can see Confluence, then you must convert your customer user accounts to Atlassian accounts. You can convert them yourself using the instructions on [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/select-the-right-account-for-your-jira-service-desk-customers-873871210.html] or you can file a support ticket and our support can bulk migrate your customer accounts to Atlassian accounts. Having an Atlassian account does not consume a license.

 

JIRA Service Desk Team
{panel}
h3.  
{panel:title=Response 13 March 2017}
Hi all,

This is expected behavior. Updating our accounts meant we had to shuffle things around a bit.

Your agents have a single account for all your Cloud products. But, your customers are special. They may not recognize Atlassian and we don't want to confuse them.

To keep your organization's branding on your help desk articles, we recommend sharing knowledge base links to your customers via the customer portal. Your customers can search for and read help articles in the portal, without needing to learn Confluence, and they don't leave your help desk experience.

Your agents can link customers to this view, and avoid linking them to Confluence. To provide a portal view of articles to your customers in an issue comment:
 * View the customer issue.
 * Under Related knowledge base articles, select the article to share or select Search knowledge base.
 * Preview the article and select Share as comment.

If you want your customers to browse all of your Confluence space, we recommend migrating them to Atlassian account. If you migrate them, they can log into your Confluence space, browse the page tree, and read articles. But, they will need to learn what Atlassian is and use our log in and account management screens. We don't recommend this for teams who serve external customers. [Learn how to migrate customers to Atlassian account|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/select-the-right-account-for-your-jira-service-desk-customers-873871210.html].

Another potential workaround is to open your Confluence space for anonymous view access, this will allow any user to view your Confluence knowledge base space without logging in. [Learn how to enable anonymous access to a Confluence space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-give-non-confluence-users-access-to-a-space-779166002.html].
 - JIRA Service Desk Team{panel}
h3. Summary

Portal users cannot access knowledge base on a cloud instance that authenticates via [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com/].
h3. Environment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - On an instance with SSO enabled (id.atlassian.com), create a service desk project linked with a Confluence knowledge base.
 - Enable unlicensed access : *Project Settings > Knowledge base > All active users and customers can access the knowledge base without a Confluence license.*
 - Create a portal only user via the Customers page in the Service Desk project.
 - Let the portal only user log in the portal.
 - Access the direct link to the knowledge base article (ie https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/display/SK/KP_Page).

h3. Expected Results

Portal only user should be able to open the page.
h3. Actual Results

Portal only user will be requested to authentic via SSO (id.atlassian.com). Login will either fail or reply with a permission error :
{noformat}
Your account doesn't have access
Looks like you don't have access to this site. If you think you should have access, contact your administrator.
If you would like to use a different email address on this site you can switch accounts.
{noformat}
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

Share the knowledge articles as comments in the service desk ticket.

*On the Service Desk agent interface* :
 - Access the ticket : https://<instancename>.atlassian.net/browse/<TicketID>.
 - Click on an article under *Related knowledge base articles* or click on *Search for Knowledge Base* to search for an article.

!kb articles.png|thumbnail!
 - Click "Share as a Comment"

!share as comment.png|thumbnail!

*On the Service Desk portal user interface* :
 - The link will be displayed in the comment.
 - Click on the link and a view of the article will be shown within Service Desk.

!portal user view.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Portal users cannot access the knowledge base

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4899].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, only customer's full name is recorded and users are not able to personalize the notifications.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow admins to record customer first/last name to allow more personal touch to the notifications.
h3. Why this is important
It allows a more personal touch to email notifications.
fields.summary: Ability to record customer first name and last name and have this available as merge fields in email templates.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4897].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

!test.png|thumbnail!

A customer saw queues taking up to 20s to load (with 35 queues in a single projects). This was because the count issues method uses jql search using {{LuceneSearchProvider}} in JIRA core to count issues for any queue. Issues for all queues are counted at page load, queue update, add issue and the polling on the queues page, to show the issue count lozenge on the left hand panel.
h3. Suggested Solution
 # store the project specific setting using the {{GlobalPropertyDao}}
 # currently issue count is done by JQL search in JIRA core
 # QueueServiceImpl accepts a bool to shouldCount for queues
 # CustomQueuesItemProvider:getqueues provides a true value for shouldCount
 # QueueAssemblerImpl:getQueues provides a shouldCount value that is passed through API call and that is false by default.

h3. Workaround
 # Reduce the amount of queues per project
 # Simplify the JQL search in each queues (avoid using SLA check when possible)
fields.summary: Loading issue count is slow when there are many queues in single project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4894].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
As an admin, I would like the ability to blacklist specific groups from a given Service Desk Role.

h3. Why this is important
This would prevent project admins from accidentally adding large groups (e.g. jira-users) to Roles (e.g. Service Desk Agents). This has the ability to create mass outgoing emails in large enterprise environments when a ticket is created and affect JIRA performance.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to blacklist certain groups from adding to roles.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like the ability to blacklist specific groups from a given Role

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4893].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When a customer is trying to visualize comments we could provide a way to segregate a view to show only internal comments, all comments, and external comments, there could be a button on the _issue tab panel_ to exhibit only internal comments, this way agents, and service desk administrators can have more control about the restricted comments and not get mixed up with customers inputs.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
It would be nice to:
# Have an additional button to view only restricted/internal comments.
OR
# Three buttons one that shows all comments (as current) another to show internal/restricted and a third button to show only customers comments.

h3. Workaround 

For Cloud, there is no current add-on nor plugin to achieve that.
fields.summary: Create a button on the issue tab panel to view only internal comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4891].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

In JIRA SD, if you go to *Customers* > *Add customers* and add a new customer, they will be automatically included in the "Service Desk Customers" Project Role.

But if you Add the user inside an Organization (either by clicking *Organization* > *Add customers* or *Customers* > *Add customers* and selecting the organization in the dropdown below the "Add customers") they WILL NOT be automatically added to the "Service Desk Customers" Project Role.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

See above.
h3. Expected Results

Customers added should be automatically included inside the project role *Service Desk Customers*
h3. Actual Results

Customers added inside an Organization are not automatically included inside the project role.
h3. Workaround

Manually add every customer to the project role.
fields.summary: Users created inside an Organization are not automatically included in the "Service Desk Customers" Project Role

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4890].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Agent is allow to manage customer and organizations in the project. This is include :-
* Create or remove customer from the project
* View the customer list
* Create and remove organization
* Add or remove customer from the organization

Same as what mention in [Setting up service desk u|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/setting-up-service-desk-users-732528877.html#Settingupservicedeskusers-Managecustomers]ser documentation.

h3. Suggested Solution
Give option to control the permission for which agent able to manage the customers/organization.

h3. Why this is important
Some organization, they do have external and internal agents. The expectation is only internal agent able to manage the customers/organization. The external agents should not have permission to do it.
fields.summary: Option to set permission for Agent to manage customer/organization in the project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4887].
  {panel}

Hi,

there isn't a resource to manage the announcements on the portals. It would be nice to have one.
This feature would allow us to communicate to our clients more easily and to automate some system status.

This would imply to create a resource on the REST API of JIRA Service Desk.

Best regards
fields.summary: Allow to manage announcement through the REST API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4884].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Service Desk is primarily focused on Help desk scenarios. In Many cases "Queue Managers" want to differentiate from the time a ticket comes in and when it gets assigned. 

h3. Suggested Solution
We should allow the change of assignee field for the "When" trigger in automation rules. 

h3. Why this is important
 This would allow for easy tracking of capacity and initial response time. You could track the time by status from when a ticket comes in to when it gets assigned.
fields.summary: Change of assignee field as a parameter in "When" trigger of automation rules.
Add Indent option when adding descriptions or comments
Feature to bulk convert Portal-only Customers to Atlassian Account.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4880].
  {panel}

*Summary*

At the moment, the issue tabs (i.e. All and History tabs) are not configurable due to the restricted functions for cloud applications.

*Suggestion*

Make issue tabs "All" and "History" configurable in order to have data for audit.
For example: in the "All" tab, insert columns with date, user, field, original value, new value.
fields.summary: Ability to imporove the JIRA "All" and "History" tabs
